name: VC Lift Encounter (No Host)
goal: Can you land the idea in a rushed elevator pitch and earn a follow-up?
description: Single-VC, time-boxed elevator encounter. No warm-up. VC starts immediately.
safety: anything involving children must be framed as monitoring/assistance only, not autonomous care

objective.thesis: Assess whether the founder can communicate a crisp one-liner, a believable demo hook, and why Gemini is essential—fast enough to earn a follow-up.
successDefinition: User + moment of use are concrete
clear market with audience willing to pay
One clear next step (what you want from the VC / what happens next)
Basic safety boundary stated if domain is sensitive

discovery.label: Lift
discovery.goal: Get to a crisp hook, fast.

interrogation.label: Snap-check
interrogation.goal: Pressure-test the weakest part in one question.

bannedPhrases: what budget does it come from

judges.label: VC (Lift)
judges.tone: impatient, curious, pattern-matching; will only follow up if it’s instantly clear

criteriaConfig.description: One-liner is crisp, specific, memorable (no jargon).
questionStarters: Doors closing—8 seconds: give me the one-liner (who it’s for + what it does + outcome).

criteriaConfig.description: Concrete user + trigger moment (when/why they reach for it).
questionStarters: When exactly do they use it—what just happened right before they open it?

criteriaConfig.description: Believable 10-second demo hook: what I would see on screen.
questionStarters: In 10 seconds, what do I see—one action, one output?

criteriaConfig.description: Audience or market is clear and there is real value to gained.
questionStarters: One sentence: where does Gemini sit in the loop and what does it produce?

criteriaConfig.description: Clear next step / ask: what you want after this lift ride.
questionStarters: What’s the one follow-up you want after this—intro, pilot, or 15 minutes?

criteriaConfig.description: If the domain is sensitive, states one responsible-use boundary.
questionStarters: If there’s any sensitive angle here, what’s one boundary you enforce in the demo?
